it.emarolab.scene_identification_tracking.semanticSceneLibrary.tracker

Interface Tracker<P,T extends Tracker.Item<?,?,P>>

  • Type Parameters:
    T - The tracked object represented as an Tracker.Item<?,?,P>. This objects should manage a Collection<Tracker.Item<?,?,P>>
    P - The primitive object describing the Semantic of the shape to track. Each 'T' object describes a primitive by adding probabilistic information for tracking.
    All Known Implementing Classes:
    ShapeTracker

    public interface Tracker<P,T extends Tracker.Item<?,?,P>>
    General interface to define an object shape tracker and propagate object's Semantics.

    This object should manage a set of #Item (i.e.: Collection<? extends Tracker.Item>), also called tracking set. Where each tracked #Item is addressable by un unique identifier (@see Tracker.Item.equals()). Thus this implementation place the base for: add(Object), remove(Object) and check if an contains(Object) and elements in the Set.
    Nevertheless, those functions should be internally used to develop a more easy interface for tracking: updateScan(Collection), updateScan(Object) and updateScan(Item). This call is aimed into update the tracked Collection with new shapes first (see: update(Object) and update(Item)). Then, it search for shapes no more in the scene by calling clean(). For each of those tracking operation, an Tracker.UpdatingState result will be returned to known the tracking operation performed by un implementation.

    Last but not the least, consider that it manages common function for adding sets of different objects. Thanks to this, is possible to manipulate the tracked Collection through two different objects:

    • the Tracker.Item ('P'), that contains also a reference to a primitive (see: Tracker.Item.getSemanticObject()).
    • the Semantics.Primitive ('P'), in this case a default tracked instance of the object will be used (see: Item#Item(Object)).
    Such a behaviour is implemented though the Tracker.CastMappingTry abstract class and used by the methods: castPrimitives(Collection) and castTrackedItems(Collection) (see also: add(Collection), remove(Collection), contains(Collection)).

    REMARK: note that it does not depends on Semantics.Primitive, but on MORPrimitive, just for id casting reasons. The tracker does not really needs a semantic structure.

    File: it.emarolab.scene_identification_tracking.semanticSceneLibrary.objects.Semantics

    affiliation: DIBRIS, EMAROLab, University of Genoa.
    date: 06/01/2017
    See Also:
    Tracker.Item, Tracker.ShapeItem, Tracker.UpdatingState, Semantics

      Nested Classes 
      Modifier and Type Interface and Description
      static class  Tracker.CastMappingTry
      The Collection<? extends {T, P}> casting helper.
      static class  Tracker.Item<S,I,P>
      The base item that defines the elements of the tracking set, managed by a Tracker.
      static class  Tracker.ShapeItem<P extends Semantics.Primitive>
      The implementation of an Tracker.Item with Integer shape identifier and OWLNamedIndividual as ID.
      static class  Tracker.UpdatingState
      The changing state during a manipulation on the tracking set (see: Tracker).

    • Method Detail

      • contains

        default boolean contains(java.util.Collection<?> set)
        Based on castPrimitives(Collection) and castTrackedItems(Collection) respectively, returns true if a set is contained in the tracking set. Its default implementations relays on: contains(Object) and contains(Item), respectively.
        Parameters:
        set - the set to check for belonging.
        Returns:
        true if the input is contained in the tracking set.

      • add

        default java.util.Collection<Tracker.UpdatingState> add(java.util.Collection<?> set)
        Based on castPrimitives(Collection) and castTrackedItems(Collection) respectively, returns the state changes performed in the tracking set for adding (or update) the inputs. Its default implementations relays on: add(Object) and add(Item), respectively.
        Parameters:
        set - the set to add or update.
        Returns:
        the changes made in the tracking set for addings. It returns Tracker.UpdatingState.asError() of the input parameter is not a Collection with elements of type: 'T' or 'P'.

      • remove

        default java.util.Collection<Tracker.UpdatingState> remove(java.util.Collection<?> set)
        Based on castPrimitives(Collection) and castTrackedItems(Collection) respectively, returns the state changes performed in the tracking set for removing the inputs. Its default implementations relays on: remove(Object) and remove(Item), respectively.
        Parameters:
        set - the set to remove.
        Returns:
        the changes made in the tracking set for removings. It returns Tracker.UpdatingState.asError() of the input parameter is not a Collection with elements of type: 'T' or 'P'.

      • update

        default java.util.Collection<Tracker.UpdatingState> update(java.util.Collection<?> objects)
        This method update the tracked set with all the object given as input considered with castPrimitives(Collection) and castTrackedItems(Collection), based on update(Object) and update(Item) respectively.
        Parameters:
        objects - the set of object ('P' or 'T?) to be updated and in the tracking set.
        Returns:
        the state changes for adding (or updating) the inputs object in the tracked set. It returns Tracker.UpdatingState.asError() of the input parameter is not a Collection with elements of type: 'T' or 'P'.

        Parameters:

        Returns:
        true if the input is contained in the tracking set.

      • contains

        boolean contains(P object)
        Returns true if an object is contained in the tracking set. This is the basic implementation for all the polymorphism for contains(...) methods. In this implementation, you should create a new Item#Item(Item).
        Parameters:
        object - the primitive object to check for belonging.
        Returns:
        true if the input is contained in the tracking set.

      • add

        Tracker.UpdatingState add(P object)
        Returns the state change performed in the tracking set for adding (or updating) the input primitive object. This is the basic implementation for all the polymorphism for add(...) methods. In this implementation, you should create a new Item#Item(Item).
        Parameters:
        object - the primitive object to add or update.
        Returns:
        the changes made in the tracking set for adding.

      • remove

        Tracker.UpdatingState remove(P object)
        Returns the state change performed in the tracking set for removing the input primitive object. This is the basic implementation for all the polymorphism for remove(...) methods. In this implementation, you should create a new Item#Item(Item).
        Parameters:
        object - the primitive object to remove.
        Returns:
        the changes made in the tracking set for removing.

      • getTrackedSet

        java.util.Collection<? extends SemanticItem> getTrackedSet()

        the tracking set.

      • updateScan

        default java.util.Collection<Tracker.UpdatingState> updateScan(java.util.Collection<?> objects)
        This method is considered to be used for updating in one shot the tracker with the new information coming from a perception module. Thus, it update the state of the internal tracking set (update(Collection)) first. And tha, it calls clean() for removing objects that are no more seen by the perceiving component.
        Parameters:
        objects - the set of objects to be updated and in the tracking set.
        Returns:
        the concatenation of returning values obtained by updating and cleaning.

      • updateScan

        default Tracker.UpdatingState updateScan(T tracked)
        This method is considered to be used for updating in one shot the tracker with the new information coming from a perception module. Thus, it update the state of the internal tracking set (update(Item)) first. And tha, it calls clean() for removing objects that are no more seen by the perceiving component.
        Parameters:
        tracked - the tracked object to be updated and in the tracking set.
        Returns:
        the concatenation of returning values obtained by updating and cleaning.

      • updateScan

        default Tracker.UpdatingState updateScan(P objects)
        This method is considered to be used for updating in one shot the tracker with the new information coming from a perception module. Thus, it update the state of the internal tracking set (update(Object)) first. And tha, it calls clean() for removing objects that are no more seen by the perceiving component.
        Parameters:
        objects - the primitive object to be updated and in the tracking set.
        Returns:
        the concatenation of returning values obtained by updating and cleaning.

      • update

        Tracker.UpdatingState update(P object)
        Base implementation for updating this tracking set. It should create a new T elemnt (see: Item#Item(Item)) and call update(Item).
        Parameters:
        object - the primitive object ot add/update in the tracking set.
        Returns:
        the updating state change performed to add/update the tracking set.

      • update

        Tracker.UpdatingState update(T tracked)
        Base implementation for updating this tracking set. It should Semantics.WritingState.ADDED the input parameter if the set if it is not available. Otherwise it checks that the probability of changing shape is high enough (Semantics.WritingState.UPDATED) to be considered. Otherwise, it Tracker.UpdatingState.AVERAGED the tracking state and the input parameter, if those are of the same shape. Where an input object is consider to be the same of an object in the tracking set by Tracker.Item.getId().
        Parameters:
        tracked - the tracked object ot add/update in the tracking set.
        Returns:
        the updating state change performed to add/update the tracking set.

      • clean

        java.util.Collection<Tracker.UpdatingState> clean()
        This function should remove(Item) elements that are no more used while updating this tracking set.
        Returns:
        the updating state change while cleaning the tracking set.
